description: German 1, a beginning-level course, introduces the German language and culture for students with no previous knowledge of German. The course focuses on speaking, reading, writing, and listening. The first-year sequence (GERM 1-GERM 2-GERM 3) starts in fall quarter only. (An accelerated sequence, GERM 1A-GERM 1B, begins in winter quarter.) (Formerly Instruction in the German Language.)
fulldesc:
GERM 1 First-Year German
German 1, a beginning-level course, introduces the German language and culture for students with no previous knowledge of German. The course focuses on speaking, reading, writing, and listening. The first-year sequence (GERM 1-GERM 2-GERM 3) starts in fall quarter only. (An accelerated sequence, GERM 1A-GERM 1B, begins in winter quarter.) (Formerly Instruction in the German Language.)
Credits 5
Instructor The Staff
Quarter Offered Fall, Winter

description: Accelerated course covers GERM 1 and part of GERM 2. It is designed for motivated beginning students. Students develop skills in speaking, reading, writing, and listening to real-life German.
fulldesc:
GERM 1A Accelerated German
Accelerated course covers GERM 1 and part of GERM 2. It is designed for motivated beginning students. Students develop skills in speaking, reading, writing, and listening to real-life German.
Credits 5
Instructor The Staff

description: Accelerated course part 2 covers part of GERM 2 and all of GERM 3. In this course, students who have successfully completed GERM 1A (or its equivalent) continue to develop competence in speaking, reading, writing, and understanding real-life German.
extrarequirements: Requirements Prerequisite(s): GERM 1A or GERM 2 or placement by examination. For students completing GERM 2, GERM 3 is preferable.
fulldesc:
GERM 1B Accelerated German
Accelerated course part 2 covers part of GERM 2 and all of GERM 3. In this course, students who have successfully completed GERM 1A (or its equivalent) continue to develop competence in speaking, reading, writing, and understanding real-life German.
Credits 5
Instructor The Staff
Requirements Prerequisite(s): GERM 1A or GERM 2 or placement by examination. For students completing GERM 2, GERM 3 is preferable.

description: GERM 2, a second-quarter course, is designed for students who have successfully completed German 1 (or its equivalent). Students continue to develop competence in speaking, reading, writing, and understanding in the context of real-life language use.
extrarequirements: Requirements Prerequisite(s): GERM 1 or GERM 1A or placement by examination.
fulldesc:
GERM 2 First-Year German
GERM 2, a second-quarter course, is designed for students who have successfully completed German 1 (or its equivalent). Students continue to develop competence in speaking, reading, writing, and understanding in the context of real-life language use.
Credits 5
Instructor The Staff
Requirements Prerequisite(s): GERM 1 or GERM 1A or placement by examination.
Quarter Offered Winter, Spring

description: GERM 3 is designed for students who have successfully completed GERM 2 (or its equivalent; e.g., 2-3 years of high school German). Students continue to develop competence in speaking, reading, writing, and understanding real-life German.
extrarequirements: Requirements Prerequisite(s): GERM 2 or placement by examination.
fulldesc:
GERM 3 First-Year German
GERM 3 is designed for students who have successfully completed GERM 2 (or its equivalent; e.g., 2-3 years of high school German). Students continue to develop competence in speaking, reading, writing, and understanding real-life German.
Credits 5
Instructor The Staff
Requirements Prerequisite(s): GERM 2 or placement by examination.
Quarter Offered Spring

description: Intermediate composition and conversation based on the reading of selected prose and related cultural material. Speaking, reading, writing, and listening comprehension skills are developed by extensive use of media materials. Conducted entirely in German.
extrarequirements: Requirements Prerequisite(s): GERM 1B or GERM 3 or placement by examination.
fulldesc:
GERM 4 Second-Year German
Intermediate composition and conversation based on the reading of selected prose and related cultural material. Speaking, reading, writing, and listening comprehension skills are developed by extensive use of media materials. Conducted entirely in German.
Credits 5
Instructor The Staff
Requirements Prerequisite(s): GERM 1B or GERM 3 or placement by examination.
General Education Code CC
Quarter Offered Fall

description: Intermediate composition and conversation based on the reading of selected prose and related cultural material. Speaking, reading, writing, and listening comprehension skills are developed by extensive use of media materials. Conducted entirely in German.
extrarequirements: Requirements Prerequisite(s): GERM 4 or placement by examination.

description: Provides a means for a small group of students to study a particular topic in consultation with a faculty sponsor. Students submit petition to sponsoring agency.

description: This third-year language and culture course is designed for students who are comfortable speaking and writing German at the GERM 5 level or above. Using a variety of German media sources, students give oral presentations and write reports on contemporary issues. Taught in German.
fulldesc:
GERM 119 German Media
This third-year language and culture course is designed for students who are comfortable speaking and writing German at the GERM 5 level or above. Using a variety of German media sources, students give oral presentations and write reports on contemporary issues. Taught in German.
Credits 5
Instructor The Staff, Zsuzsanna Abrams
Requirements Prerequisite(s): GERM 5 or placement by examination.
Repeatable For Credit Yes
General Education Code CC

coursename: GERM 120 Advanced German Conversation and Composition
description: This third-year language course is designed for students who are comfortable speaking and writing German at the GERM 5 level or above. Using a variety of German texts, including print- and visual media, students practice advanced conversation and composition skills. Taught in German.
fulldesc:
GERM 120 Advanced German Conversation and Composition
This third-year language course is designed for students who are comfortable speaking and writing German at the GERM 5 level or above. Using a variety of German texts, including print- and visual media, students practice advanced conversation and composition skills. Taught in German.
Credits 5
Instructor The Staff
Requirements Prerequisite(s): GERM 5.
General Education Code CC
Quarter Offered Spring
